sen.j: 花山院 師信（かざんいん もろのぶ、建治元年（1275年）- 元亨元年11月1日_(旧暦)（1321年11月20日））は、鎌倉時代後期の公家。
sen.e: Moronobu KAZANIN (1275 - November 20, 1321) was a court noble who lived in the late Kamakura period.

sen.j: 父は内大臣花山院師継、母は家女房毛利季光の娘。
sen.e: His father was Naidaijin (the Minister of the Interior) Morotsugu KAZANIN, and his mother was a daughter of Suemitsu MORI and was Ie no Nyobo (a lady-in-waiting).

sen.j: 元弘の変で後醍醐天皇方として活躍した花山院師賢は息子。
sen.e: Morokata KAZANIN who did splendid service at the Emperor Godaigo's side in Genko no hen (Genko Incident) was his son.
Morokata KAZANIN who performed splendidly at the Emperor Godaigo's side in the Genko Incident was his son.

sen.j: 後宇多天皇の蔵人頭から17歳で参議、正安元年（1299年）に権中納言、嘉元元年（1303年）に権大納言と順調に出世を重ねる。
sen.e: Moronobu had been successfully promoted from Kurodo no to (Head Chamberlain) of the Emperor Gouda, then Sangi (councillor) at the age of 17, then Gon Chunagon (Provisional Middle Counselor) in 1299, and then Gon Dainagon (Provisional Major Counselor) in 1303.

sen.j: 2度の後宇多上皇の院政では、伝奏を務めた。
sen.e: He served as denso (messenger to Emperor) in two periods of insei by the retired Emperor Gouda.

sen.cmt: the Retired Emperor Goudaとし、inseiの補足追加

sen.j: 対立関係にある持明院統の花園天皇からも「和漢の才に富んだ補佐役」として評価されて信頼が厚かった。
sen.e: Even Emperor Hanazono of Jimyoin line, who was at the opposite side of Moronobu, trusted Moronobu much by rating him "aid with remarkable talents of Japanese and Chinese".
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処

sen.cmt: 後の"Daikakuji-to"に合わせ、"Jimyoin-to"とし、補足追加 (用語集参照)、シングルクォーテーションに変更、ピリオドの位置を移動

sen.j: 花園朝では大覚寺統系の公家が軒並み要職から外されていく中で正和5年（1316年）に異例の大納言昇進を果たした。
sen.e: Among court nobles of Daikakuji-to (imperial lineage starting with Emperor Kameyama) who were ousted from important posts in the court of Emperor Hanazono one after another, Moronobu alone was exceptionally promoted to Dainagon in 1316.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処

sen.j: 続いて大覚寺統に政権が戻った後醍醐天皇の元応元年（1319年）には内大臣に昇進する。
sen.e: In 1319 when the Emperor Godaigo of Daikakuji-to subsequently returned to power, Moronobu was promoted to the Minister of the Interior.

sen.j: 花園上皇がその日の日記に「大きな損失である」と記すなど、大覚寺統・持明院統双方からその死を惜しまれた。
sen.e: Both Daikakuji-to and Jimyoin-to regretted the death of Moronobu as exemplified by the retired Emperor Hanazono recording in his diary for the day of Moronobu's death "We had a great loss."
